main event: A large, bright, oval-shaped object was observed traveling at a tremendous speed near Marshall, Michigan, on February 8, 1964.
interesting points: The object was approximately 75 feet in diameter and illuminated from within., The object was observed moving east to west at an altitude of about 2000 feet., The sighting lasted about 30 seconds before the object disappeared., The observer is a radar technician and noted this was unlike any conventional aircraft he had seen., Several stars were visible in the southeast, but nothing compared to this object.
